author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
Thank you, European Union, for your appreciation. 

Your support and partnership have been instrumental in our efforts to improve the health and well-being of the people of our region. https://t.co/6nQhvi9m7y
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
I truly appreciate your kind words, @WHOWPRO Member States.

Working together across regions has greatly contributed to advancing health and well-being for all.

I am grateful for your invaluable support and our shared commitment to #HealthForAll. https://t.co/i5rEsH6UxC
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
Sincere thanks for the appreciation I received today at the ongoing 156th session of @WHO Executive Board in #Geneva.

What an immense privilege it has been to lead @WHO in the African region.

It has been an honour to work alongside dedicated colleagues, partners and communities committed to making a lasting impact.

To our Member States, I extend my heartfelt thanks. Your courage, resilience and determination have inspired me every day. 

Over the past decade, we have worked side-by-side to strengthen health systems and advance universal health coverage, to expand access to care.

We have celebrated groundbreaking milestones

To our partners, none of our successes would have been possible without you. Your technical and financial support and our joint action have been instrumental in driving innovation and impact.

To @DrTedros, my deepest gratitude for standing beside me throughout this journey.

Finally, to our staff ‚Äì the heartbeat of the Organization. Whether in country offices, at the regional level or on the frontlines of outbreaks, you have made a significant difference in the lives of millions.

However, the challenges ahead remain significant.

But I am confident that the strong foundations we have built together will enable @WHO to continue making a difference.

Thank you for the support, collaboration and the shared vision that continue to drive our progress.

It has been the honour of a lifetime!
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti
Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
Following confirmation of a Sudan virus disease outbreak in Uganda, WHO is accelerating efforts to support the national health authorities and partners in scaling up measures to swiftly contain and end the outbreak.

We are deploying public health emergency experts and readying medical supplies to deliver to the country to bolster the response.

Read more‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/bjlDkz0eyY
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
Congratulations, Niger üá≥üá™, on achieving @WHO verification for eliminating onchocerciasis (river blindness) as a public health problem‚Äîthe first country in the African region to do so!

This is a significant milestone in the fight against neglected tropical diseases. 

Onchocerciasis has long caused immense human suffering, and this achievement reflects the dedication of the government, partners, health workers, and communities who made it possible.
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text: Thank you @AUC_MoussaFaki, African Union Commission Chair, for your solidarity. Appreciate the strong partnership with @_AfricanUnion & our shared endeavour to promote, protect and preserve health in the region and across the world.
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
Today, we crossed another milestone at @WHOAFRO in our collective efforts towards equitable health leadership: 5 remarkable women health experts joined the Mwele Malecela Mentorship Programme for women in the fight against #NTDs.

We remain strongly committed to promoting purpose-driven leadership & gender equity to create meaningful impact on the health of our populations.
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text: We‚Äôre stepping up our support to #Tanzania in the efforts to end the #Marburg outbreak. Our priority is to ensure strong & effective measures are in place to protect communities & promptly halt the spread of the virus.
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
#Tanzania today confirmed an outbreak of #Marburg. @WHO appreciates the determination by H.E President @SuluhuSamia & the government‚Äôs action to address the threat of this disease & prevent potential cross-border spread.

We‚Äôre committed to supporting the government to rapidly scale up measures to effectively respond to this outbreak and safeguard the health of the population.

Read more ‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/sfoD8iIQPW
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
As #Tanzania takes steps in the investigation and response to the suspected Marburg outbreak, @WHO stands ready to support the national authorities to strengthen the ongoing measures.

https://t.co/hnGKK9ZUtO
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
January is #CervicalCancer Awareness Month.

#CervicalCancer is one of the most successfully treatable forms of cancer when detected early & managed effectively.

Yet, this preventable disease claims the lives of 76,000 women in the African region every year.

We can protect the next generation of women by accelerating #HPV vaccination rates, increasing access to prevention, screening & treatment services.

I urge governments and partners to prioritize these life-saving measures, ensuring women and girls everywhere can access the care they need.
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
Women make up 70% of Africa's healthcare workforce but remain underrepresented in leadership.

@WHOAFRO's partnership with @WomenLiftHealth aims to empower women, strengthen health systems, and drive lasting impact, fostering a healthier and more equitable future for all. https://t.co/dLWlEdXK3I
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
Very saddened by the news about the passing of President Jimmy Carter. 

His work through the @CarterCenter contributed hugely to the #elimination & #control of #NTDs in Africa. 

President Carter‚Äôs unwavering commitment to #GuineaWorm eradication leaves a huge legacy - freeing millions from the burden of #disease, improving livelihoods, & reducing #inequality.

We will continue to work tirelessly to ensure that his vision of a world without NTDs becomes a reality.
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
Today #Rwanda declared the end of the #Marburg outbreak. Leadership, partnerships, science & strong community involvement have proven key to bringing the outbreak to an end. 

Congratulations to the government, partners, health workers and @WHO colleagues who supported all aspects of the response to ensure effective control and stopping the spread of the virus!
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti

text:
My thoughts are with the thousands of families & households facing devastating damage from #CycloneChido in northern #Mozambique. 
@WHO experts are on ground supporting health authorities in two provinces & today is sending another team, along with medical supplies & equipment. https://t.co/VVKq5c3Cgo
author: Dr Matshidiso Moeti
